availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Greenup Pickrell (Fleming County, Kentucky, farmer, grocer, and justice of the peace.)

body.p: Fleming County, Kentucky, farmer, grocer, and justice of the peace. Virginia native. Son of William Pickrell. Married to Mary Pearce Pickrell. Father of James Pickrell, Sarah Pickrell, Thomas Pickrell, Mary Pickrelll, and Emily Pickrell. Married to Eliza Kissick Pickrell. Father of Monroe Pickrell and Henry Pickrell. Farmer in Fleming County in 1850. Justice of the peace in Fleming County in 1854. Grocer in Fleming County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, Division 2, p. 374A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 1, p. 803.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994034, Fleming County Births.
Revolutionary War Pension and Bounty-Land Warrant Application Files, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series M804, Roll 1420.
W.H. Perrin, J.H. Battle, and G.C. Kniffin, Kentucky: A History of the State (Louisville, KY: F.A. Battey and Company, 1888) p. 946.
